title: coinwen
author: coinwen
created_time: March 22, 2023, 09:00:22 PMLast edit: November 17, 2023, 09:50:41 PM by coinwen
content: The Coinwen.net platform allows you to search  for your favorite crypto, enter how many coins you have or would like to have, and then the price you would like to see that coin get to. Our system will then tell you the required market cap needed in order for that coin to hit the price you've entered along with the percentage increase (or decrease). With real-time market data and intuitive tools, coinwen.net is the perfect resource for any crypto enthusiast. Visit us today and start making informed investment decisions!https://www.coinwen.net

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: I tried the site on the AGIX coin, it seems to work well, but I would have preferred if there was a list of the 100 best coins in the market, for example, and it would be better to add a date to the search to know the most searched coins.In general, the site provides statistics and numbers on the Required Market Cap to reach the required price, but I am not sure how important these numbers are.I mean, what's the point if I know what a Required Market Cap is? If I already bought the coin would this help?

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: yhiaali3 on March 30, 2023, 06:03:16 PMI mean, what's the point if I know what a Required Market Cap is? If I already bought the coin would this help?I also think giving a marketcap number in a vacuum is not a good idea, especially if there is no clear distinction between fully diluted marketcap or just the latest token/coin in circulation marketcap. It also assumes that there are no other metrics to determine or show how far a coin needs to reach that marketcap. For example, if a coin currently has a billion marketcap but a very low trading volume, it might take a shorter/longer time to reach the specific marketcap depending on the circumstances.That being said, if a user knows how to interpret the data, I can still see the website being used as an instant calculator as long as they regularly update the data feed. Other indicators that OP can add are probably trading volume, market depth, buy/sell pressure, and so on. I believe if OP adds that, the site will see more visits since it is kinda unique as a trading helper.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Interesting site. I don't remember ever coming across a similar one that performs the same calculations. A few suggestions:- Your market cap and contact tabs are empty. The contact tab says to get in touch with you if I have any inquiries, but how when there is no email address or contact form?- I noticed that you have some news articles at the bottom of the page. It would be a good idea to also add a tab or a button at the top that takes you directly to the news section.- A useful feature would be to show the users who searched for certain coins news articles specifically concerning those assets. So if I performed a search on Monero, for example, I could see recent news about it.
